item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 16, 2025 at 7:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Docs – Open source alternative to Notion or Outline (710 points | 263 comments)
2. Amiga 600: From the Amiga No One Wanted to Retro Favorite (31 points | 13 comments)
3. Our Interfaces Have Lost Their Senses (30 points | 14 comments)
4. Did the Particle Go Through the Two Slits, or Did the Wave Function? (66 points | 50 comments)
5. That Time I Recreated Photoshop in C++ (142 points | 53 comments)
6. Teach, Don't Tell (2013) (7 points | 1 comment)
7. Edgar Allan Poe's life was a mess. But his work was in his command (51 points | 35 comments)
8. Big LLMs weights are a piece of history (181 points | 127 comments)
9. Comet open source remote KVM from GL-iNet (42 points | 15 comments)
10. Meticulous (YC S21) is hiring to eliminate E2E UI tests ( | hide)
11. Raytracing on Intel's Arc B580 – By Chester Lam (61 points | 36 comments)
12. Local-First and Ejectable (5 points | discuss)
13. "Wait, not like that": Free and open access in the age of generative AI (49 points | 3 comments)
14. Show HN: My high school team’s space probe (115 points | 22 comments)
15. Peru's Great Urban Experiment (2023) (31 points | 8 comments)
16. A Princely Ploy: Inside the Ruse of a French-Armenian Scammer (19 points | 1 comment)
17. Apple's long-lost hidden recovery partition from 1994 has been found (266 points | 87 comments)
18. High-performance computing, with much less code (72 points | 7 comments)
19. Abuse of power at Germany's elite research institution [video] (29 points | 2 comments)
20. City simulator I made in Scratch (134 points | 14 comments)
21. Command A: Max performance, minimal compute – 256k context window (53 points | 13 comments)
22. zlib-ng: zlib replacement with optimizations for "next generation" systems (20 points | 1 comment)
23. Hours in a Hurricane, on a Race with No Course (10 points | 4 comments)
24. Sketch-of-Thought: Efficient LLM Reasoning (14 points | 1 comment)
25. A powerful free and open source WAF – UUSEC WAF (14 points | 9 comments)
26. Implications of Global Privacy Control (56 points | 35 comments)
27. The British Nationality Act as a Prolog Program (1986) [pdf] (24 points | 7 comments)
28. Lego says it wants to start to bring video game development in-house (154 points | 90 comments)
29. ESP32 WiFi Superstitions (130 points | 71 comments)
30. Toni Morrison's Lost Play (16 points | 1 comment)
